description: Pale grey upper surface, black lower surface (except on young lobes), with numerous pin-like isidia on the upper surface .
Lobes pale green on the upper surface and whitish on the lower surface; strap-like, flattened; with soredia present on upper surface of well-developed specimens.
Beard lichens - greenish-grey, with a central core (visible when the branch is stretched); often pendent.
Hair lichens - green-brown to brown; hair-like and fine without central core; pendent when well developed.
Green-grey to brownish; branches erect, solid, with many digitate branchlets at the tip.
Script lichens - thallus whitish grey, fruiting bodies elongate with raised lip-like margins.
Thallus white to cream with soredia in conspicuous rounded clusters and occasional whitish fruiting bodies with a thick margin (thallus and sorediared)
Thallus whitish, fruiting bodies brown to black; irregular to branched; not raised above the surface.
Thallus grey with black margin, often forming a mosaic on smooth bark; fruiting bodies black (c. 1 mm diameter); disc-like, concave with distinct black margin (orange).
Thallus grey-green with pale margin, fruiting bodies small, (c. 0.5 mm diameter); rounded, convex without distinct margin ( negative).
Sorediate granules (< 1 mm) often with yellow fruiting bodies (negative).
Lobes broad (to 7 mm wide), spreading yellow to greenish, orange fruiting bodies often present.
Lobes leaf-like, more or less appressed with soredia in white spots (red), lower surface pale tan.
Xanthoria polycarpa (A) and X. ucrainica (B). Lobes narrow (to 1 mm wide), erect. X. polycarpa A has abundant fruiting bodies; X. ucrainica B has marginal soredia.
Lobes leaf-like; overlapping with a network of pale lines that become sorediate in P. sulcata while P. saxatilis has isidia on the upper surface.
Lobes small narrow (c. 1 mm wide) with white lower surface and conspicuous black-tipped cilia along the margins of the lobes. Both have soredia at the lobe ends.
Lobes swollen, hollow when cut; without rhizines
